meanings.definition: An amount that is more than what is needed or used
meanings.sent1: The store had surplusses of canned food that they donated to the local shelter.
meanings.sent2: The company had to sell their surplusses of office supplies at a discount.
meanings.sent3: The picnic had so many surplusses of sandwiches that even the ants couldn't finish them all.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled over like surplusses of joy spilling out of a cup.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing basket of apples was a visual representation of surplusses.

meanings.definition: Excess or extra goods or supplies
meanings.sent1: The warehouse stored surplusses of winter coats for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's market had a sale to clear out their surplusses of fresh produce.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party had so many balloons, it looked like a surplusses factory.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a surplus that spilled over into the lives of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing shelves in the pantry were filled with surplusses of canned goods.
